arts.ttl: Brighton score late winner to shock Man City
arts.sum: Watch highlights as Manchester City suffer back-to-back Premier League defeats with Brighton scoring late to earn their first win of the season.

arts.ttl: Pep Guardiola says Manchester City ‘forgot to play’ in defeat at Brighton
arts.athr: Jonathan Wilson at the Amex Stadium
arts.sum: City lose two of first three games for first time in 21 years Fabian Hürzeler turns match with quadruple substitution Pep Guardiola said his team “forgot to play” after they gave up a lead to lose 2-1 at Brighton. It was Manchester City’s second defeat of the season, the first time they have lost two of their first three league games in 21 years. City had taken the lead through Erling Haaland and seemed to have the game under control when the Brighton manager, Fabian Hürzeler, made a quadruple substitution after an hour and levelled from a James Milner penalty seven minutes later. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Match Report: Brighton & Hove Albion 2-1 Manchester City
arts.sum: The first chance for the home side on 18 minutes seen Minteh win the ball deep in his own half who played the ball nicely into Welbeck who then poked it through the gaps to play Mitoma through on goal which sees Trafford tested for the first time this afternoon, the resulting corner fizzled out into nothing. City’s skipper committing a foul outside of his own box giving the home side their first real chance in the second half on 54 minutes, the resulting free kick resulted in a goal kick for City.

arts.ttl: Hurzeler says Brighton's Gruda can be a 'game-changer' in any team after Man City win
arts.sum: While Hurzeler said Albion's second half was not the best football he had seen during his tenure at the club, their fighting spirit thrilled the German. "I think this can be a signal for him [Gruda] that if he trains hard, if he plays consistently, if he pushes his limits, he can be a game-changer for every team in the world," said Hurzeler.

arts.ttl: Man City's new 'reality'? Rodri slams 'kids' mistakes' in Brighton defeat
arts.sum: Rodri says Manchester City's "reality" is that they're "not at the level" required and slammed his team's "kids' mistakes" in their defeat at Brighton.

arts.ttl: Pep Guardiola admits Man City ‘forgot to play’ after Brighton penalty
arts.sum: James Milner cancelled out Erling Haaland’s opener before Brajan Gruda scored a dramatic late winner for the Seagulls.

arts.ttl: Pep Guardiola Slammed For Full-Time Actions After Brighton 2-1 Man City
arts.sum: Football fans aren't impressed with Guardiola after the loss

arts.ttl: Late Brajan Gruda goal secures Brighton comeback win over fading Man City
arts.sum: after Matheus Nunes inexplicably handled Lewis Dunk's volley in the box.

arts.ttl: 'It's just one game' - Guardiola unfazed by Brighton defeat
arts.sum: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says he has "no complaints" with their performance despite losing 2-1 to Brighton in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: James Milner dedicates goal against Man City to former Liverpool team-mate Diogo Jota as he performs his trademark celebration
arts.sum: James Milner paid tribute to former Liverpool team-mate Diogo Jota after scoring his first Premier League goal in six years on Sunday.
